title: ScottishPower teams up with Good Energy to demand end of 'misleading' greenwashing
lead: ​ScottishPower and Good Energy are calling for regulatory reforms to close what they have labelled as “loopholes” in the energy retail market that allow for greenwashing.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Octopus Energy relaunches joint venture with Midcounties Co-op as Younity
lead: ​Octopus Energy and The Midcounties Co-operative are relaunching their community energy joint venture as Younity.
author: Alice Grundy

title: InstaVolt partners EV subscription service Onto to support increased uptake
lead: ​InstaVolt has become the latest electric vehicle (EV) charging network to be available to drivers through EV subscription service Onto.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SPEN to trial ‘clean-air’ switchgear from Siemens in Glasgow
lead: ​SP Energy Networks is to pilot new switchgear technology developed by Siemens that has the potential to reduce the volume of greenhouse gas used at its substations.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: E.On launches renewables-backed EV charging tariff
lead: ​E.On Next is launching two new tariffs designed to be climate friendly, one focused on electric vehicles (EVs) and one offering the perk of tree planting.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SP Energy Networks tenders for 1.4GW of flexibility
lead: ​Network operator SP Energy Networks (SPEN) has put out a call for flexibility, with a tender for 1.4GW of services across areas in SP Manweb and SP Distribution.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Moto hails ‘significant first step’ as it opens the ‘UK’s largest EV charging site’
lead: ​Motorway service area giant Moto has announced its largest ultra-rapid charging site, which will open in Rugby tomorrow (30 April).
author: Molly Lempriere

title: ‘No sign of a roadmap’: PAC slams lack of leadership from HMRC and Treasury
lead: ​The Public Accounts Committee (PAC) has criticised a “lack of leadership and coordination” from HMRC and the Treasury in targeting environmental action.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Osprey celebrates first installation of Tritium RTM75 chargers in Europe
lead: ​Osprey Charging Network is lauding the installation of the first Tritium RTM75 rapid chargers in Europe, with these located in Gosport, UK.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Siemens installs over 1,000 on-street EV chargers in City of Westminster
lead: ​Westminster City Council is celebrating the installation of over 1,000 on-street electric vehicle (EV) chargers as part of its rollout with Siemens.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Get the economics of heat decarbonisation right or risk failure, suppliers warn
lead: ​A collection of energy suppliers have commissioned a report from consultancy Public First to tackle what they described as unfairness in the energy market for customers wanting cleaner heating.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Current± Chats: EVBox's Jonathan Goose on the 'real demand' for pre-bookable park and charge spaces
lead: Current± ​caught up with Jonathan Goose, regional director of UK and Ireland at EVBox, to talk about reducing anxiety through pre-bookable spaces and how it is currently "bananas" in the charging business.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Ohme expands into Europe with Volvo partnership
lead: ​UK electric vehicle (EV) charging firm Ohme has signed a deal with Volvo that sees it takes its first steps into the European market.
author: Alice Grundy

title: ElectraLink appoints Jonathan Purdy as chairperson as Kevin Lee steps down
lead: ​ElectraLink has appointed Jonathan Purdy as chairperson, following the news Kevin Lee is to retire last week (22 April).
author: Molly Lempriere

title: WPD teams up with local authorities for EPIC project
lead: ​Western Power Distribution is to explore the benefits of collaboration between local authorities and network companies through its new Energy Planning Integrated with Councils (EPIC) project.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Modo makes new chief product officer hire as it focuses on product-first approach
lead: ​Energy data start-up Modo has appointed Nima Tabatabai as chief product officer following stints at Kiwi Power and Piclo.
author: Alice Grundy

title: SaaS provider Innowatts opens Irish office as it continues expansion into Europe
lead: Energy software-as-a-service (SaaS) provider Innowatts is expanding its European presence, with a new office set to open in Cork, Ireland.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Ofgem launches consultation into half-hourly settlement
lead: ​Ofgem has launched a consultation into the implementation and governance arrangements of the introduction of half-hourly settlement.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Iduna raises £4m for EV charging in Manchester in just six days
lead: ​Car charging scheme Iduna has attracted over £4 million in investment in just six days.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Vattenfall eyes offering energy infrastructure for electric trucks in Tevva MoU
lead: ​Vattenfall Network Solutions has signed a Memorandum of Understanding with UK-based electric truck firm Tevva to support fleet electrification.
author: Alice Grundy
